title: Eslint installation issues
body:
Hi,
I am very new to Eslint but I would like to use your eslint configuration. Therefore I've created a new .eslintrc.json file in the root folder and put 
```
{
  "extends": "airbnb"
}
```
into it. Then I tried to install your config with `npm install --save eslint-config-airbnb` which threw some errors though:

> +-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint@^3.19.0 || ^4.3.0                                                                                                                             
> +-- eslint-config-airbnb@15.1.0                                                                                                                                                
> | +-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint@^3.19.0 || ^4.3.0                                                                                                                           
> | `-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-import@^2.7.0                                                                                                                        
> +-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-import@^2.7.0                                                                                                                          
> +-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@^5.1.1                                                                                                                        
> `-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-react@^7.1.0      

                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                               

> npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb@15.1.0 requires a peer of eslint@^3.19.0 || ^4.3.0 but none was installed.                                                                       
> npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb@15.1.0 requires a peer of eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@^5.1.1 but none was installed.                                                                  
> npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb@15.1.0 requires a peer of eslint-plugin-import@^2.7.0 but none was installed.                                                                    
> npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb@15.1.0 requires a peer of eslint-plugin-react@^7.1.0 but none was installed.                                                                     
> npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb-base@11.3.1 requires a peer of eslint@^3.19.0 || ^4.3.0 but none was installed.                                                                  
> npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb-base@11.3.1 requires a peer of eslint-plugin-import@^2.7.0 but none was installed.                                                               
> npm WARN brawlstats.io@1.0.0 No description                                                                                                                                    
> npm WARN brawlstats.io@1.0.0 No repository field.                                                                                                                              
> PS C:\Users\user\Documents\project-express> ^C^C                                                                                                                         
> ESLint!
> Ln 1, Col 1 (27 selected)Spaces: 2UTF-8CRLFJSON master* 0↓ 2↑00
> Close

VSCode shows:
> InfoCannot find module 'eslint-config-airbnb' Referenced from: c:\Users\user\Documents\project-express\.eslintrc.json


What am I doing wrong?

title: Yarn instructions for eslint-config-airbnb potentially installs incorrect version of peer dependencies
body:
# Context
The Yarn instructions at [eslint-config-airbnb](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-config-airbnb) readme currently installs the latest version of each peer dependency.

# Expected
Following the yarn instructions would install the correct peer dependencies.

# Actual
I encountered the error `Definition for rule 'jsx-a11y/href-no-hash' was not found` when running `yarn run eslint .` after following the Yarn instructions.

The Yarn instructions install the latest version of `eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y` which installs `eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@6.0.2` but the peer dependency is `eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@^5.1.1`

`eslint-config-airbnb` depends on a rule that no longer exists in `plugin-jsx-a11y@6.0.2`

# Workaround
1. Install package with `yarn add -D eslint-config-airbnb`
1. Run `npm info "eslint-config-airbnb@latest" peerDependencies` to get list of peer dependencies and their respective versions
1. `yarn add -D [dependency@version]` eg, `yarn add -D eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@^5.1.1`
1. Repeat for each peer dependency listed in step 2

title: Clarification for Inline Comments
Confusing example for multiline comment
Is there any way I can get an .eslintrc JSON file that contains all the JavaScript Style Guide rules?
body:
Hi,

I'd like to use the `eslint-config-airbnb-base` rules in PHPStorm (as default settings for their great auto-formatter).  In the newest [2017.2 release](https://blog.jetbrains.com/webstorm/2017/06/webstorm-2017-2-eap-172-3198/) they have introduced a feature that allows for `.eslintrc` rules importing... but from what I can see the importer can't deal with `.eslintrc.js` files - which is not a big problem, but also it is not able to parse extends - which is a problem.

So we still can't import eslint settings from the `eslint-config-airbnb-base` module installed with NPM. 
 
So I'm looking for a simple, raw `.eslintrc` JSON file that contains all the `eslint-config-airbnb-base` rules. I could import this file with PHPStorm. Is there any place I could find (or generate?) such file?

---
BTW
Maybe you could get in touch with JetBrains guys and convince them to include the airbnb style guide as one of their code styles presets? At the moment we can choose from "JavaScript Standard Guide", "Google JavaScript Style Guide" and "Drupal JavaScript Guide" (btw, does anyone use it except Drupal core developers?). Airbnb style guide is the second, most popular JS guide, so it's a shame that JetBrains devs didn't include this preset.

title: Bug happened when both "eol-last" and "semi" exist.
body:
why this can pass the rule?
```
ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'))
;
```
even this:
```
ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'))


;
```
but eslint give me a "no-multiple-empty-lines" error when I use 3 blank line
```
ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'))



;
```
so it cause a bug when I use ESLint auto fix func:
```
ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'))

```
after fix the code above but reserve a "eol-last" rule not fixed
```
ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'))
;
```

title: JSX Expression Formatting (spaces after opening and before closing braces)
body:
What is Airbnb's interpretation for the formatting rules for spaces after opening and before closing braces? To illustrate: ```javascript // Option 1: No spaces
{foo(1, "abc")}
// Option 2: Yes spaces
{ foo(1, "abc") }
``` Thank you.

title: New rules suggestion to prevent common coding typos (length and constructor)
body:
As a non native english developper I lost a huge amount of time fixing the same typos again and again.

I fixed common **`constructor`** typos using [id-blacklist](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/id-blacklist) rule. It's safe because who would ever use those IDs:

```js
{
  "id-blacklist" : ["error",
    "contructor",
    "contrutor",
    "construtor",
    "construcor",
    "constuctor"
  ]
}
```

I also fixed **`length`** typos using [no-restricted-properties](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-restricted-properties), It's safe because what evil mind would ever use `lenght` in any code?!

```js
{
  "no-restricted-properties" : ["error", {
    property : "lenght"
  }]
}
```
Could we have this directly within [eslint-config-airbnb-base](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base)?

This could save the world a huge amount of time 😉 

Related issue: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/8940

PS: I'm pretty sure there is many other use cases, for example this related issue about `propTypes` typos: https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/65 (and see also [react/no-typos](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/master/docs/rules/no-typos.md))

title: Rule not enforced
body: Hello! I noticed [this rule](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#comparison--shortcuts) was not being enforced - just recommended. Is there a reason for that?

title: Prefer namespace imports
command `npm test` not works on win 10.
body:
I'm trying to run the tests of this package in win 10, these are my command lines:

```bash
git clone git@github.com:airbnb/javascript.git airbnb
cd airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb
npm i
npm test
```

then I get this:

```bash
> eslint-config-airbnb@15.0.2 pretest D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb
> npm run --silent lint

fs.js:994
  binding.lstat(pathModule._makeLong(path), statValues);
          ^

Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, lstat 'D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb\*'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.lstatSync (fs.js:994:11)
    at D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb\node_modules\editorconfig-tools\lib\cli.js:83:16
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb\node_modules\editorconfig-tools\lib\cli.js:81:25
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at Object.<anonymous> (D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb\node_modules\editorconfig-tools\lib\cli.js:78:24)
    at Object.<anonymous> (D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb\node_modules\editorconfig-tools\lib\cli.js:276:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:570:32)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:487:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:446:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:438:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:497:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (D:\repo\airbnb\packages\eslint-config-airbnb\node_modules\editorconfig-tools\bin\index.js:8:11)
```

then I try this:

```bash
.\node_modules\.bin\editorconfig-tools check * rules/* test/*
```

and get the same result.

I really have no idea with this, please help me.

title: colocation of tests
warning "eslint-config-airbnb-base@11.2.0" has incorrect peer dependency "eslint@^3.19.0"
body:
Not sure what to do here or if I should worry about this warning, but when I try running yarn add eslint I get the following error:

warning `eslint-config-airbnb-base@11.2.0` has incorrect peer dependency `eslint@^3.19.0`.

I'm running this in a create-react-app (not ejected)

My dependencies:
```
